p: The patient may be tested to evaluate their mental health and brain conditions associated with the cognitive skills. The interpretation of symptoms might indicate a wide range of conditions, like vitamin B-12 deficiency, thyroid disorder, dementia, or AD. To rule out or overcome this problem, certain confirmatory test will have to be conducted at a laboratory. Medical imaging with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), computed tomography (CT), positron emission tomography (PET), and/or single-photon emission computed tomography (SPECT) has been extensively utilized to diagnose the AD. Notwithstanding, they may not be useful to differentiate between the other conditions mentioned above [ 39]. But these techniques are definitely helpful in predicting the different stages of AD [ 40]. The loss or degeneration of brain cells associated with AD can be shown up in many ways. The present generation imaging techniques have evolved to help identify and differentiate brain tumors, hemorrhages and strokes, apart from the different types of neurodegenerative diseases [ 40].
